KFC Shopner Pathshala

KFC Shopner Pathshala is a project designed to provide underprivileged street-bound children with basic education, vocational training and a safe environment to learn and grow.Each morning, the restaurants are transformed into classrooms where the children are taught with basic literacy in Bangla and English, as well as health and hygiene, psychological aspects and creativity. The school aims to build character and prepare the children for a brighter future. With the support of LEEDO and Mojar School, KFC is committed to providing a nurturing environment where every child can chase their dreams and make something of their life.

Weaving Dreams

Discovering fun

Outside of the class curriculum, the children are taught how to introduce themselves and how to read books. They also sing, dance, recite poetry, and play games like ludo, carrom and puzzles with other kids. This teaches the kids beyond the books, where they get introduced to a world where their worries about day-to-day struggles fade away. Lastly, they are provided with food during classes so that they don 't have to deal with hunger at all while learning. But the main reason behind these activities is that these kids enjoy learning and have multiple reasons to continue learning.

Gallery

Basic Literacy

The program aims to empower children with foundational literacy skills in both Bangla and English, fostering the ability to comprehend, communicate, and navigate a diverse world.

By focusing on basic literacy, the project not only addresses immediate educational needs but also lays the groundwork for continuous learning and intellectual growth.

Vocational Training

Beyond academic education, the initiative recognizes the importance of practical skills for the children's future economic independence.

Vocational training provides the children with hands-on experience in various trades, preparing them for potential employment opportunities and entrepreneurship.

Health & Hygiene

The inclusion of health and hygiene education underscores the holistic approach to child development.

By instilling good health practices, the program contributes to the overall well-being of the children, preventing illness and promoting healthy habits that can last a lifetime.

Psychology

The psychological component of the curriculum reflects a commitment to addressing the emotional and mental well-being of the children.

Understanding psychological aspects equips the children with coping mechanisms, resilience, and emotional intelligence, crucial for navigating life's challenges.

Creativity

The emphasis on creativity recognizes the value of artistic expression in cognitive development and self-discovery.

Creative activities not only stimulate imagination but also enhance problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and the ability to express oneself in unique ways.

Human Values

Incorporating human values into the education model signifies a commitment to shaping not just knowledgeable individuals but morally grounded citizens.

Teaching values such as empathy, compassion, and integrity contribute to character development and helps the children become positive contributors to their communities.
